moduleInfo.moduleTitle: Basic Theory and Practices/09 Strategy Pillars Topics Buckets/Content Buckets

overview.quote: Buckets are your shows – they're the repeatable formats that viewers come to know you for before they even know your name.
overview.introText: Content buckets are your repeatable video formats that combine your pillars and topics into recognizable 'shows' on your channel. They're the templates that make content creation easier and help viewers understand what to expect.

keyTerms.definition: Repeatable video formats that combine your pillars, topics, and pre-validated framing into recognizable content types.
Proven content structures (like listicles or reactions) that audiences already respond well to on social platforms.
The momentum your content gains when the platform understands your niche and consistently shows your videos to the right audience.
Content distribution strategy with 70% broad appeal content, 20% focused content, and 10% niche but high-converting content.

actionPlan: Combine pillars with proven content formats
Test each bucket with multiple videos
Refine successful buckets based on data

mainContent.title: The Bucket Formula
mainContent.text: Content buckets = Pillars × Topics ÷ Pre-validated Framing. Combine what you want to say with formats viewers already love. Like a fitness coach using listicles for nutrition hacks or comparison videos for gym wear trends.

summaryPoints: Start with your pillar and topic
Test and iterate based on performance

mainContent.title: The 70-20-10 Strategy
mainContent.text: Balance your content with 70% broad/entertaining videos to attract viewers, 20% focused/educational content to build trust, and 10% niche content for conversions. This creates a natural funnel for your audience.

summaryPoints: Adjust ratios as your account grows

mainContent.title: Algorithmic Advantages
mainContent.text: Consistent buckets help the algorithm understand your content and recommend it to the right viewers. When someone engages with two videos in the same bucket, they're likely to be shown more, creating a pathway to following you.

summaryPoints: Builds recognition before your name does

mainContent.title: Testing & Iteration
mainContent.text: Try each bucket multiple times before deciding if it works. Even good ideas need refinement. Look at engagement metrics, comments, and shares to understand what resonates, then iterate to make your buckets even stronger.

summaryPoints: Don't be afraid to abandon what fails

proTips.text: The first few videos in a bucket rarely hit – the algorithm needs time to learn who to show them to. Patience pays off!
Save your strongest calls-to-action for your 10% niche content where viewers are already highly engaged with your message.

finalWords.description: Viewers follow patterns before they follow people!
